abstract.text: Returns a single-precision sparse matrix object.

The number of columns of the matrix. Must be greater than 0.
A matrix object that is ready for receiving entries. If an error occurs,

This function creates a sparse matrix object that is stored in point-wise format and is ready to receive values from the various insert routines.  Point-wise format means individual values are stored for a given
location as opposed to blocks of values.  For block support use the block create routines.  See the various insert routines for details on inserting entries into this matrix object.
After you’ve finished with the matrix, it’s important that you free the memory allocated to it with

Apple provides the BLAS and LAPACK libraries under the Accelerate framework to be in line with LAPACK 3.9.1. Starting with iOS 19, iPadOS 19, macOS 16, tvOS 19, watchOS 19, and visionOS 3, the libraries are in line with LAPACK 3.12.0. These new interfaces provide additional functionality, as well as a new ILP64 interface. To use the new interfaces, define
before including the Accelerate or vecLib headers. For ILP64 interfaces, also define
as preprocessor macros in Xcode build settings.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a single column of a double-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a single column of a single-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a double-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a single-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a single scalar entry into a double-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a single scalar entry into a single-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a single row of a double-precision sparse matrix.
Inserts a list of scalar entries into a single row of a single-precision sparse matrix.
Returns a double-precision sparse matrix object.
Returns a single-precision sparse matrix object.
Releases any memory associated with the matrix object.
Sparse matrix opaque type for float.
